results.title: Egypt: a new horizon
results.creator_credit: Alfred Wagg Pictures and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.
results.description: The River Nile has always been the key to Egypt’s economy. Today it is bringing a new horizon to Egypt. It is the source of hydro-electric power, and is vital to the projects of reclaiming previous arid land. Other Egyptian industries, and the tourist trade are discussed.

results.title: Egretta
results.brief_description: A life history of the four species of egrets commonly found in Australia, the white egret, the great egret, the white crane and the white heron.

results.title: Ego development: the core of a healthy personality(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Arthur M Kaye and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Analyses the establishment of ego qualities and the setting and achievement of goals in very young children. Proper resolution of the conflict between biological, psychic, and societal demands leads to the establishment of a healthy ego

results.title: The Egg of oryzias latipes
results.brief_description: Artificial fertilization of the killifish. through constant research a method of artificial fertilization of the transparent eggs of killifish or oryzias latipes, in Ringer’s solution was discovered. The delayed-action camera shows the process observed through the microscope.

results.title: Effective writing: revise and improve
results.brief_description: Illustrates various ways in which writing can be improved by reconstructing sentences, substituting better words, and using the dictionary. Depicts the tribulations of a high school student attempting to write a composition. Produces images of the content of his composition on screen as he revises and corrects his work with the help of the narrator.

results.title: The Eel
results.brief_description: Eel is an important source of Vitamin A, and a popular food in Japan. The life cycle of the eel is illustrated, showing the migration of the baby eels from their oceanic birth places to the coast of Japan, and subsequent life in the streams or in the commercial ponds of the eel farms. The techniques of eel-raising are shown.

results.title: Edwardian newsreel
results.creator_credit: B F I National Film Library
results.brief_description: Records events and personalities during the reign of Edward VII, compiled from contemporary newsreels. The film covers a wide field of events including the funeral of Queen Victoria, and suffragette disturbances, the Delhi Durbar and finally the funeral of Edward V11.
results.description: Records events and personalities during the reign of Edward VII, compiled from contemporary newsreels. The film covers a wide field of events including the funeral of Queen Victoria, and suffragette disturbances, the Delhi Durbar and finally the funeral of Edward V11.

results.title: Education in Tamagawa
results.brief_description: A survey of the Tamagawa educational project, founded in 1929, just outside Tokyo. Children may enrol in the primary school and leave nineteen years later as graduates of the university. The eductational philosophy encourages the fostering of creativity through self-motivated study and the all-round curriculum includes work on the experimental farm as well as cultural and intellectual activities.

results.title: Education?
results.creator_credit: Chris Noonan, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The possible future choices for education, ranging from the free schools approach to the use of technology as a teaching supplement are examined. This film is not an in-depth analysis of these issues, but rather is a discussion-raiser for teacher or parent groups looking at issues of alternatives in education
